title: Definitions
text:
Definitions. In this Charter Party, the following terms shall have the meanings hereby assigned to them:

(a) "Owners" means the registered owners of the Vessel.
(b) "Charterers" means the party stated in Box 3.
(c) "Vessel" means the vessel named in Box 5, with her machinery, boats, appurtenances and equipment.
(d) "Cargo" means any goods or merchandise to be carried under this Charter Party.
(e) "Freight" means the remuneration payable to the Owners for the carriage of cargo.
(f) "Port" means any port, place, anchorage, or area where the Vessel may be instructed to load or discharge cargo.
(g) "Safe Port" means a port which the Vessel can reach, use, and return from without being exposed to dangers which cannot be avoided by good navigation and seamanship.
(h) "Laytime" means the time allowed for loading and discharging cargo.
(i) "Demurrage" means the amount payable for time used in excess of the Laytime.
(j) "Despatch" means the amount payable for time saved in loading and/or discharging.

title: Owners' Obligations
text: Owners' Obligations. The Owners shall provide and pay for all provisions, wages, and consular charges; provide and pay for all cabin, deck, and engine-room stores; maintain the Vessel's class; and maintain the Vessel, hull, and machinery in a thoroughly efficient state during the voyage.

title: Charterers' Obligations
text: Charterers' Obligations. The Charterers shall provide and pay for all fuel except for domestic use; pay for port charges, pilotage, towage, canal dues, light dues; provide and pay for loading, stowing, trimming, and discharging cargo; procure and pay for all necessary permits, licenses, and customs documentation.

title: Cargo
text: Cargo. The Vessel shall proceed to the loading port(s) or place(s) stated in Box 10 or so near thereunto as she may safely get and lie always afloat, and being so loaded shall proceed to the discharging port(s) or place(s) stated in Box 11 or so near thereunto as she may safely get and lie always afloat.

title: Freight
text: Freight. Freight shall be paid at the rate stated in Box 13 per metric ton on intake quantity. Payment shall be made as stated in Box 14. Freight shall be deemed earned on shipment, and shall be paid in full, ship and/or cargo lost or not lost.

title: Loading/Discharging
text:
Loading/Discharging.
(a) The cargo shall be loaded and discharged within the number of running days as stated in Box 15 and 16.
(b) Time for loading and discharging shall commence at 13:00 hours if notice of readiness is given before noon and at 06:00 hours next working day if notice is given during office hours after noon.
(c) The Master shall give the Charterers or their agents notice of the Vessel's readiness to load or discharge in writing, by cable, telex or telefax.

title: Laytime
text:
Laytime.
(a) Separate laytime for loading and discharging.
(b) Total laytime for loading and discharging.
(c) Time to count from 13:00 hours if notice of readiness is given up to and including 12:00 hours, and from 06:00 hours next working day if notice is given during office hours after 12:00 hours.
(d) Time lost waiting for berth to count as laytime.

title: Demurrage
text: Demurrage. Demurrage at loading and discharging port(s) shall be paid at the rate stated in Box 19 per day or pro rata for any part of a day. Demurrage shall be payable day by day.

title: Lien
text: Lien. The Owners shall have a lien on the cargo for freight, deadfreight, demurrage and average contribution due to them. The Charterers shall have a lien on the Vessel for non-payment of any sums due to them under this Charter Party.

title: Bills of Lading
text: Bills of Lading. The Master shall sign Bills of Lading as presented by the Charterers or their agents in accordance with mates' receipts, provided such Bills of Lading are in conformity with this Charter Party. If the Charterers require a third party to sign Bills of Lading on behalf of the Master, the Charterers hereby indemnify the Owners against any consequences arising therefrom.

title: Both-to-Blame Collision Clause
text: Both-to-Blame Collision Clause. If the Vessel comes into collision with another vessel as a result of the negligence of the other vessel and any act, neglect or default of the Master, mariner, pilot or the servants of the Owners in the navigation or in the management of the Vessel, the Charterers will indemnify the Owners against all loss or liability to the other or non-carrying vessel or her owners in so far as such loss or liability represents loss of, or damage to, or any claim whatsoever of the owners of said cargo.

title: General Average
text: General Average. General Average shall be adjusted, stated and settled according to York-Antwerp Rules 1994 at such port or place in such currency as the Owners may determine.

title: Taxes
text: Taxes. All taxes and dues on the Vessel or freight levied at ports of loading shall be for Owners' account. All taxes and dues on the cargo shall be for Charterers' account.

title: Agency
text: Agency. At ports of loading the Charterers shall appoint the Vessel's agents, at ports of discharge the Owners shall appoint the Vessel's agents. The agents at loading ports shall be remunerated by the Charterers and the agents at discharge ports by the Owners.

title: Brokerage
text: Brokerage. A brokerage commission at the rate stated in Box 21 on the freight earned is due to the brokers named in Box 22. Payment shall be made to the brokers on freight prepaid within 5 banking days of signing Bills of Lading, otherwise on receipt of freight.

title: Clause Paramount
text: Clause Paramount. This Charter Party is subject to the Hague-Visby Rules contained in the International Convention for the Unification of Certain Rules relating to Bills of Lading dated 25th August 1924, as amended by the Protocol signed at Brussels on 23rd February 1968 and by the Protocol signed at Brussels on 21st December 1979.

title: Law and Arbitration
text: Law and Arbitration. This Charter Party shall be governed by and construed in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Charter Party shall be referred to arbitration in London in accordance with the Arbitration Act 1996 or any statutory modification or re-enactment thereof save to the extent necessary to give effect to the provisions of this Clause.

title: War Risks
text: War Risks. The Vessel shall not be obliged to proceed to or through any port, place, area, or zone where it appears that the Vessel, her cargo, crew, or other persons on board the Vessel, in the reasonable judgement of the Master and/or the Owners, may be exposed to War Risks.

title: Ice
text: Ice. The Vessel shall not be required to force ice. In the event that a loading or discharging port is inaccessible due to ice, or in the event that after entering the port the Vessel is frozen in or in danger of being frozen in, the Master may proceed to the nearest ice-free position and give notice to the Charterers.

title: Deviation
text: Deviation. The Vessel shall have liberty to call at any port or ports in any order, for any purpose, to sail without pilots, to tow and/or assist vessels in all situations, to deviate for the purpose of saving life and/or property at sea.

title: Strike
text: Strike. If loading or discharging is prevented or delayed by strike, lockout, stoppage, restraint of labour, civil commotion, or other cause beyond the control of the Charterers or their agents or the Owners or their agents, time so lost shall not count as laytime.

title: BIMCO Infectious or Contagious Diseases Clause
text: BIMCO Infectious or Contagious Diseases Clause. The Vessel shall not be required to proceed to or remain at any port where there is a risk that the Vessel, crew, or cargo may be affected by infectious or contagious diseases. If such disease is reported after the Vessel's arrival, the Master may leave the port.

title: BIMCO Sanctions Clause
text: BIMCO Sanctions Clause. The Charterers warrant that neither they nor any company within their group are, or will become, subject to sanctions, restrictions, penalties, or trade embargoes that would render their performance of this Charter Party unlawful.

title: Notices
text: Notices. All notices given under this Charter Party shall be given in writing by electronic mail, facsimile, or other agreed method of communication to the addresses stated in Boxes 23 and 24.
